intro: Monadenia ecalcarata, commonly known as the spikeless burr legume, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes many legumes known for their nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or greenish, and it produces dry, dehiscent pods that contain seeds. Monadenia ecalcarata is often found in grassland and rocky habitats, and it plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for various insects and animals.
